title: California Residential Lease Agreement
description: Comprehensive residential lease agreement compliant with California landlord-tenant laws. Includes rent, security deposit, maintenance, and termination provisions.

content.html:
RESIDENTIAL LEASE AGREEMENT

This Residential Lease Agreement (the "Lease") is made and entered into on {{lease_start}} by and between:

Landlord:
{{landlord_name}}
{{landlord_address}}

and

Tenant:
{{tenant_name}}

(collectively referred to as the "Parties").

1. PREMISES

Landlord agrees to rent to Tenant and Tenant agrees to rent from Landlord the residential property located at:

{{property_address}} (the "Premises")

2. TERM

The term of this Lease shall begin on {{lease_start}} and end on {{lease_end}} (the "Term").

3. RENT

Tenant shall pay monthly rent of ${{monthly_rent}}, payable in advance on the first day of each month. Rent shall be paid to Landlord at the address specified above.

4. SECURITY DEPOSIT

Tenant shall pay a security deposit of ${{security_deposit}} upon execution of this Lease. The security deposit shall be returned within 21 days of lease termination, less deductions for damages beyond normal wear and tear.

5. LATE PAYMENTS

If rent is not received within 5 days of the due date, Tenant shall pay a late fee of ${{late_fee}}.

6. UTILITIES

Tenant shall be responsible for all utilities and services to the Premises, including electricity, gas, water, sewer, and trash removal.

7. MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS

Tenant shall keep the Premises clean and in good condition. Tenant shall promptly notify Landlord of any needed repairs or maintenance.

8. PETS

{{#pets_allowed}}Pets are allowed with prior written consent from Landlord and payment of a pet deposit of $500.{{/pets_allowed}}{{^pets_allowed}}No pets are allowed on the Premises without prior written consent from Landlord.{{/pets_allowed}}

9. ASSIGNMENT AND SUBLETTING

Tenant shall not assign this Lease or sublet the Premises without prior written consent from Landlord.

10. ACCESS TO PREMISES

Landlord may enter the Premises at reasonable times with 24 hours notice to inspect, repair, or show the property to prospective tenants or buyers.

11. DEFAULT

If Tenant fails to pay rent or breaches any provision of this Lease, Landlord may terminate this Lease and take possession of the Premises.

12. HOLD HARMLESS

Landlord shall not be liable for any damage or injury to Tenant or Tenant's guests, except for damage or injury caused by Landlord's negligence.

13. GOVERNING LAW

This Lease shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California.

14. ENTIRE AGREEMENT

This Lease constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes all prior negotiations and understandings.

Landlord
Tenant
Date

source.modified: Updated for California compliance and ContractFabrico format

sample_data.property_address: 456 Oak Avenue, Apt 2B, Santa Monica, CA 90401
